user_stories.summary: Setup project repository and folder structure
user_stories.description:
## User Story
As a **developer**, I want a **well-organized project structure**, so that **I can easily navigate and understand the codebase**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Repository created with standardized folder structure
- [ ] All required directories present (.cursor/rules, context, domain, deliverables, src, tests, data, logs)
- [ ] .gitignore configured to exclude sensitive files and caches
- [ ] Initial README.md with project description
- [ ] VERSION file initialized at 0.1.0
- [ ] All AI development guidelines in .cursor/rules/

## Technical Notes
- Follow BairesDev project structure standards
- Include domain entity definitions
- Setup deliverables folder for PRDs and epics

## Story Points
5

## Priority
Highest

## Type
Task

user_stories.summary: Configure Python virtual environment and dependencies
user_stories.description:
## User Story
As a **developer**, I want a **configured Python environment**, so that **I can install dependencies consistently**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Python 3.10+ virtual environment created
- [ ] requirements.txt with pinned versions
- [ ] All core dependencies installed (Streamlit, pytest, Black, pylint, mypy)
- [ ] Virtual environment activation documented in README
- [ ] Dependencies install without errors
- [ ] Version compatibility verified

## Technical Notes
- Use venv for virtual environment
- Pin all package versions for reproducibility
- Include dev dependencies separate section

## Dependencies
- Requires: RFP-2 (project structure)

## Story Points
5

## Priority
Highest

## Type
Task

user_stories.summary: Create basic Streamlit app with navigation
user_stories.description:
## User Story
As a **user**, I want a **basic Streamlit application**, so that **I can navigate through different pages**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Streamlit app runs on localhost:8501
- [ ] Multi-page structure implemented
- [ ] Navigation sidebar with page links
- [ ] Home page with project overview
- [ ] Placeholder pages for main features
- [ ] Basic styling and branding applied
- [ ] App loads without errors

## Technical Notes
- Use Streamlit's native multi-page support
- Create src/main.py as entry point
- Setup src/ui/ for UI components
- Include session state management

## Pages to Create
1. Home / Dashboard
2. Upload RFP
3. Requirements
4. Risk Analysis
5. Service Matching
6. Generate Draft

## Dependencies
- Requires: RFP-3 (dependencies installed)

## Story Points
8

## Priority
Highest

## Type
Task

user_stories.summary: Implement code quality tools (Black, pylint, mypy)
user_stories.description:
## User Story
As a **developer**, I want **automated code quality tools**, so that **I can maintain consistent code standards**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Black configured with line length 88
- [ ] pylint configured with project-specific rules
- [ ] mypy configured for strict type checking
- [ ] isort configured for import sorting
- [ ] Configuration files in project root (.pylintrc, pyproject.toml)
- [ ] All existing code passes quality checks
- [ ] Commands documented in README

## Technical Notes
- Create pyproject.toml for tool configuration
- Setup .pylintrc for custom rules
- Configure mypy for gradual typing
- Integrate with IDE (VSCode/Cursor)

## Quality Gates
- Black: All files formatted
- pylint: Score >= 8.0/10
- mypy: No errors in strict mode
- isort: All imports sorted

## Dependencies
- Requires: RFP-3 (dependencies installed)

## Story Points
3

## Priority
High

## Type
Task

## User Story
As a **developer**, I want a **testing framework**, so that **I can write and run tests reliably**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] pytest installed and configured
- [ ] pytest-cov for coverage reporting
- [ ] Test directory structure created (tests/ with subdirectories)
- [ ] conftest.py with shared fixtures
- [ ] Sample test passing
- [ ] Coverage report generated (target: 80%+)
- [ ] Test commands documented in README

## Technical Notes
- Create tests/ directory matching src/ structure
- Setup pytest.ini for configuration
- Include fixtures for common test scenarios
- Configure coverage exclusions

## Test Structure
```
tests/
├── __init__.py
├── conftest.py
├── test_models/
├── test_services/
├── test_llm/
└── test_integration/
```

## Dependencies
- Requires: RFP-3 (dependencies installed)

## Story Points
5

## Priority
High

## Type
Task

## User Story
As a **developer**, I want **environment-based configuration**, so that **I can manage secrets securely**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] .env.example file with required variables
- [ ] .env added to .gitignore
- [ ] Configuration loader in src/config.py
- [ ] Environment variables validated on startup
- [ ] Clear error messages for missing variables
- [ ] Documentation for obtaining API keys
- [ ] No secrets committed to repository

## Technical Notes
- Use python-dotenv for loading
- Create src/config.py for centralized config
- Validate all required variables
- Provide defaults for optional settings

## Required Environment Variables
```
# LLM Configuration
GEMINI_API_KEY=
GROQ_API_KEY=

# Google Docs Export
GDOCS_CREDENTIALS_PATH=

# Application Settings
DEBUG=False
LOG_LEVEL=INFO
```

## Dependencies
- Requires: RFP-2 (project structure)

## Story Points
3

## Priority
High

## Type
Task

user_stories.summary: Setup Git hooks and pre-commit checks
user_stories.description:
## User Story
As a **developer**, I want **automated pre-commit checks**, so that **I don't commit code that fails quality standards**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] pre-commit framework installed
- [ ] .pre-commit-config.yaml configured
- [ ] Hooks run Black formatting automatically
- [ ] Hooks run pylint checks
- [ ] Hooks prevent commits with errors
- [ ] Hooks documented in README
- [ ] Team can install hooks easily

## Technical Notes
- Use pre-commit framework
- Include hooks for: Black, isort, pylint, trailing whitespace, YAML validation
- Configure to run on git commit
- Allow bypass with --no-verify flag (documented)

## Pre-commit Hooks
1. Black (auto-format)
2. isort (sort imports)
3. pylint (linting)
4. trailing-whitespace
5. end-of-file-fixer
6. check-yaml
7. check-added-large-files

## Dependencies
- Requires: RFP-5 (code quality tools)

## Story Points
3

## Priority
Medium

## Type
Task

## User Story
As a **new developer**, I want **clear setup instructions**, so that **I can get started in under 30 minutes**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Comprehensive README.md created
- [ ] Quick Start section with step-by-step instructions
- [ ] Prerequisites listed clearly
- [ ] Installation commands provided
- [ ] Running the app documented
- [ ] Testing commands documented
- [ ] Troubleshooting section included
- [ ] Links to additional documentation
- [ ] New developer can setup in < 30 minutes

## Technical Notes
- Follow markdown best practices
- Include code examples
- Add badges for build status, coverage
- Link to PRD and other docs

## README Sections
1. Project Overview
2. Business Value
3. Features
4. Technology Stack
5. Prerequisites
6. Quick Start
7. Usage Guide
8. Development
9. Testing
10. Documentation
11. Contributing
12. Support

## Dependencies
- Requires: All other Epic 1 stories completed

## Story Points
3

## Priority
Medium

## Type
Task

## User Story
As a **developer**, I want **automated CI/CD**, so that **tests run automatically on every push**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] GitHub Actions workflow created
- [ ] Workflow runs on push and PR
- [ ] Workflow runs all tests
- [ ] Workflow checks code quality (Black, pylint, mypy)
- [ ] Workflow generates coverage report
- [ ] Workflow fails if tests fail or coverage < 80%
- [ ] Status badge added to README
- [ ] Workflow documented

## Technical Notes
- Create .github/workflows/ci.yml
- Use Python 3.10, 3.11, 3.12 matrix
- Cache dependencies for speed
- Upload coverage to Codecov (optional)

## CI Pipeline Steps
1. Checkout code
2. Setup Python
3. Install dependencies
4. Run Black (check only)
5. Run isort (check only)
6. Run pylint
7. Run mypy
8. Run pytest with coverage
9. Upload coverage report

## Dependencies
- Requires: RFP-6 (test infrastructure)
- Requires: RFP-5 (code quality tools)

## Story Points
5

## Priority
Medium

## Type
Task

## User Story
As a **developer**, I want **structured logging**, so that **I can debug issues and monitor application behavior**.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Logging configured with DEBUG default level
- [ ] Logs written to both console and file
- [ ] Log rotation implemented (daily, keep 30 days)
- [ ] Structured log format with timestamp, level, module, message
- [ ] Different log levels used appropriately (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL)
- [ ] Sensitive data never logged
- [ ] Logging utility in src/utils/logging_config.py
- [ ] All modules use configured logger

## Technical Notes
- Use Python logging module
- Create src/utils/logging_config.py
- Configure log rotation with RotatingFileHandler
- Set up different formatters for console vs file

## Log Configuration
```python
# Default Level: DEBUG
# Console: INFO and above
# File: DEBUG and above
# Format: [%(asctime)s] %(levelname)s [%(name)s] %(message)s
# Rotation: 10MB per file, keep 5 files
```

## Dependencies
- Requires: RFP-2 (project structure)

## Story Points
3

## Priority
Medium

## Type
Task
